main event: On April 25, 1957, a civilian reported observing a large, red, crescent-shaped object descending slowly in the sky near Ringgold, Louisiana.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 25 minutes and the object was described as glowing and filling the observer's field of vision., The object was stated to cover several trees as it hovered above them., Multiple witnesses made informal reports but no detailed investigation was conducted at the time., Local authorities suggested that the sighting could be attributed to aircraft exhaust, yet no confirmation backed this claim., The object was not associated with any known Air Force operation or weather balloon activity.
witness description: a civilian named Steve Rushton who reported seeing the object.
